Program: Applied Artificial Intelligence for Digital Production Management
Focus: Artificial Intelligence, Digital Production Management, Machine Learning, Intelligent Systems
Admission requirements:
The qualification for the Master's degree course in Applied Artificial Intelligence for Digital Production Management at the Cham location is proven by the completion of an undergraduate academic degree at a domestic or foreign university with at least 210 ECTS credits in the field of Industrial Engineering, Production Engineering, Mechatronics or a related degree course or an academic degree that is equivalent to such a certificate of academic degree. 
The aptitude test is carried out by means of an examination, the subject of which is complex tasks on relevant topics from mathematics for engineers as well as on questions from the fields of production and logistics, physics, computer science, statistics and simulation. This written admission examination, offered online and at the Cham campus of the Deggendorf University of Applied Sciences, is used to determine suitability for the specific degree course.

An outstanding academic degree in the fields of informatics or related areas (bachelor’s degree, German diploma degree), or equivalent which should have in general a grade better than 2.5.
    Proof of English language ability for non-native speakers: e.g. ToEFL 550 (paper-based) resp. 213 (computer-based) resp. 79 (internet-based). Other language scores are considered as well.

Annotation: Artificial intelligence and machine learning are the future – many areas have already been conquered. In the distance learning Master's degree in Artificial Intelligence at the IU, become an expert in computer-based language and image processing, intelligent production in Industry 4.0 or for autonomous vehicles. While specific artificial intelligences have long since been in use in medicine and materials management, but the development of general AI that behaves similarly to humans still has a great deal of development potential, you will be able to work in innumerable areas as an AI specialist.
Admission requirements:
You have completed an apprenticeship or further education, work experience or have already studied? Then let your previous achievements be recognized for the correspondence course! This way you save time as well as tuition fees - namely EUR 30 per recognized ECTS point.
\t
- Shortening your study time: Skip individual modules or entire semesters!
- Save on tuition: For every ECTS point you get you save EUR 30.

We will be happy to check before your application for distance learning whether and to what extent we can take your previous achievements into account: noncommittally and 100% online. Simply fill out our online recognition form.

Program: Artificial Intelligence and Data Science for Digital Business Management

Annotation:
Excellent career and salary prospects in Germany and worldwide. Most of our students receive job offers before they get their academic degree.

AI is revolutionizing and driving the new business era. Our graduates are sought-after experts who understand both the technology and the economic aspects. You will benefit from a strong and growing job market in Germany and a solid salary level.

This Executive Master's degree programme uniquely positions graduates at the interface between innovative IT and digital business management. Typical professions are Data Scientist, Business Analyst, AI Consultant, AI Project Manager, Digital Business Developer, Digital Business Consultant, E-Commerce Manager, Performance Marketing Manager and IT System Administrator.

Companies value our graduates because they can quickly make themselves useful with a wide range of applicable knowledge. The hybrid form of the lectures supports the flexibility and mobility of our students to accept a working student position and continue their studies wherever the company is located.

Our international students and graduates work in world-leading companies such as Accenture, EY, KPMG, PWC, Deloitte, IBM, HP, SAP, Oracle, Vodafone, eBay, Amazon, Lufthansa, TUI, Expedia, Trivago, Audi, Porsche, Mercedes-Benz, Hugo Boss, Bosch, Siemens, Aldi and Lidl.

Prof. Dr. Pavel Rawe, PhD
Dean of Studies International Business Information Systems (BSc.) (IBS)
Consultation hours:  Appointment lists for booking office hours are posted on Prof. Rawe's office door - Building I, Room 2.09 No appointments are given online, by telephone or by email.

Area Of Study: Design Engineering | Production Engineering | Software Engineering
Focus: Automotive Software Technology, Embedded Systems, Real-time and Communication Systems, Computer Science
Automotive Computer Science, Software Engineering, Software-defined vehicle, Securecar, Autonomous driving, Driver Assistance Systems, Artificial Intelligence
Annotation: The automotive industry is one of the most important industries in Bavaria. In addition to large car and truck manufacturers, numerous supply companies are also located here. For the mobility of the future, more and more functions are being implemented via software in modern vehicles. In some cases, more than 200 control units are installed in a vehicle and up to 16 gigabytes of software data are imported. Software is therefore a crucial key component, which is why the industry is now talking about Software Defined Vehicles (SDV). This development requires highly complex systems with hardware and software components for more and more safety, comfort and entertainment on board, which in turn requires highly qualified experts for development and implementation.
Admission requirements:
- Bachelorabschluss in Informatik, Elektro- und Informationstechnik oder einem verwandten Fach.
- Erfolgreich absolvierter Einstellungstest und Auswahlgespräch.
- Sprachanforderungen
Die Zulassung ist in der Studien- und Prüfungsordnung festgelegt (§ 5 Qualifikation und Zugangsvoraussetzungen sowie Zulassung).

The aim of the Master's degree course in "Business Mathematics" is to specialise and broaden the specialist skills acquired in the Bachelor's degree course in "Business Mathematics "or "Mathematics". You will study current research literature and work scientifically on a problem from the field of business mathematics as part of your Master's thesis.

Economics:

Area Of Study: Psychology | Philosophy | Computational Linguistics | Neuroscience | Artificial Intelligence
Focus: Artificial Intelligence, Cognitive Psychology, Neuroscience, (Computational) Linguistics, Neuroinformatics, Philosophy of Cognition
Annotation:
Cognitive science examines phenomena such as perception and attention, memory and learning, planning, decision-making and problem solving, feeling, thinking, speaking and acting. In the 1970s, it evolved from a series of scientific/technical and humanities-related individual subjects into an interdisciplinary and multidisciplinary subject. On the one hand, it is about understanding cognitive phenomena in biological systems. On the other hand, the knowledge that is gained is used to create artificial systems with comparable capabilities. While cognition was originally understood as a symbol processing process in the brain, cognitive research is now interested in a broad spectrum of phenomena that often also include the body and parts of the environment. Nevertheless, methods such as those of machine learning in artificial neural networks remain central to cognitive research. However, it also uses modern measurement methods (e.g. EEG, eye tracking) and allows subjects to explore virtual realities or examines the social behaviour of primates to learn more about cognition beyond the classic laboratory situation. Philosophical questions such as those on the ethics of artificial intelligence are not neglected either. 

The Master's degree programme in "Cognitive Science" gives students the opportunity to specialise at greater depth in at least two sub-fields of cognitive science – (computer) linguistics, cognitive (neuro) psychology, artificial intelligence, neuroinformatics, neurosciences and philosophy – and to develop their individual academic profile in accordance with their interests and academic background. In interdisciplinary courses, students learn to understand and establish connections between the sub-areas of cognitive science. As part of a two-semester study project, they deal intensively with a research question and develop a solution approach, present and document it and gain valuable experience in independent project management under conditions that are common in professional scientific research at universities and in industry. The master's thesis, in which students can demonstrate their research competences in detail, takes place at the end of the course.

Students of the Master's degree programme in "Cognitive Science" in Osnabrück can apply for an international double degree programme in collaboration with the University of Trento/Rovereto (Italy).
Admission requirements: Qualified Bachelor's degree in a 'Cognitive Science' course or a comparable degree. Graduates from participatory or related disciplines may also be admitted. Additionally, proof of a command of English at language level B2 according to the CEFR, as well as a written application providing evidence of aptitude and motivation for the course.

Area Of Study: Electrical Engineering | Mechanical Engineering | Software Engineering | Applied Mathematics
Annotation:
Course Objective

After successful completion of the degree course, you will have access to a portfolio of knowledge, skills and competencies in the field of numerical simulation, modelling of engineering problems and a profound understanding of mechanical problems. Graduates are specialised in the simulation of structures, fluids, thermomechanical processes and electromechanical interactions and are able to translate complex physical systems into mechanical models and use suitable tools to predict system behaviour by means of sophisticated numerical analyses.


Professional fields later on

The methods in the field of Computational Methods in Engineering are the future-oriented techniques that modern engineers need. Typical applications include for instance:

    3D structural analyses, non-linear dynamics, optimisations, multi-body dynamics, crash simulations and acoustics in automotive engineering and general mechanical engineering
    Fluid-structure interaction, structure optimisation, supersonic flight characteristics and high-temperature stresses in aerodynamics and process engineering
    Material models (e.g. bones, tissue), prostheses, implants and artificial blood vessels in biomechanics and medical technology

Graduates will work professionally at the interfaces between mechanical engineering, process engineering, electrical engineering, computer science and mathematics as specialists for numerical analyses and simulations of complex technical problems. They will span the gap between the classic engineering disciplines, mathematics, computer science and software development.
Admission requirements:
Relevant Bachelor’s academic degree (at least 180 CP) and an average grade of at least 2.5 determined from the examination results

Proof of subject-related skills through
- At least 15 CP in Mathematics and Computer Science,
- 40 credit points in Engineering Principles
(including 10 credit points in Technical Mechanics, 5 credit points in Fluid Mechanics or Thermodynamics)

Application is possible if the academic degree has not yet been completed at the time of application and no more than 25 CP are missing until the Bachelor's degree programme has been successfully completed in full. This has no bearing on the proof of subject-related competencies and the determined grade point average of 2.5 at the time of application.

Annotation: Computer Science is a subject area that is changing rapidly, is at the cutting edge of our age and has become the pacemaker for the digital society of the future. In the English-language IU Master's degree programme in Computer Science, you will focus on Data Science, Cybersecurity and Artificial Intelligence. Due to the unmet need for experts on these topics, you will become a sought-after specialist who can work in almost all industries. Focus: Cyber Attacks & Threat Management, Intelligent Systems, Machine Learning
Deadlines: There are no application deadlines. There are special procedures for verifying qualifications or the ability to qualify for the intended course of study.
Annotation: Have you completed your bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field and are you now ready to advance your career? Are you eager to become a digital expert and enhance your methodological and technological knowledge in Cyber Security and Artificial Intelligence through a study program in Germany? If so, our English-language Master's program in Computer Science (MSc) is the perfect choice for you.
Admission requirements:
You need to have a completed bachelor's degree with at least 180 credit points.
In your bachelor’s degree you must have gained at least 60 credit points in the fields of computer science, software engineering, information technology, or another field with at least 60 CP in computer science-related topics such as mathematics, programming, design, and software architecture.
Your English language skills must be equivalent to Level B2 of the European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR).

Annotation:
Our degree program offers you a computer science education that includes classical modules such as software development and programming, but also provides specialised knowledge in the field of Big Data and Artificial Intelligence.

You learn about the latest big data technologies and how to implement AI and machine learning tools in companies and the business environment. In addition to technological expertise, the practice-oriented curriculum helps you to specialise your analytical, business and soft skills in various projects and internships.

University/Hochschule: SRH University of Applied Sciences Heidelberg
Area Of Study: Applied Computer Science | Computer Science | Practical Computer Science | Information Systems and Management
Focus: Cyber Security, Information Security, Information Security, IT Security, Computer Science, Business Informatics, Data Analysis, Data Analysis, Data Security, Safety
Deadlines: You can apply to SRH University at any time. | You can apply to SRH University at any time.
Annotation:
Our degree course trains you to become a cyber security specialist who has profound IT knowledge and who can plan and implement information security systems and measures in companies and other institutions. 

You will deal with current topics such as blockchain, DevSecOps and cryptocurrencies and receive comprehensive training in the field of information security. In addition to specialised knowledge in security technologies, IT security management and data analysis, you are just as familiar with operational processes and organisational theory as you are with the legal challenges in data protection.
Admission requirements:
To apply for the Master's degree programme in Computer Science - Cyber Security, you will need:

- University or university of applied sciences degree (Bachelor’s or Diploma degree) in computer science and related disciplines
-Letter of motivation
- Certificate of general or subject-specific higher education entrance qualification
- Proof of English
- Curriculum vitae with current passport photo
- Copy of identity document (front and back) or, for foreign students, copy of passport or national identity card

Area Of Study: Applied Computer Science | Computer Science | Practical Computer Science | Software Engineering | Artificial Intelligence
Focus: Cyber-Security, IT Security, Secure Computer Systems, Privacy – Personal Data Protection in the Digital World, Cryptography, Malware, Cyber Attacks, Usable Security, Web Security, Machine Learning in Cybersecurity
Admission requirements:
Admission requirements are:

Bachelor's academic degree from a German university or an equivalent degree course from a foreign university in computer science or a related subject (does not have to be a Bachelor's degree in cybersecurity)
English language proficiency at advanced level (usually C1)
Proof of skills that correspond to those taught in the Bachelor's degree programme in "Cybersecurity" at Saarland University in the core area of computer science, in particular in the following areas: 1. Mathematics (discrete mathematics, linear algebra, stochastics, statistics), 2. Theoretical Computer Science (Complexity Theory, Calculability), 3. Practical computer science (functional and object-orientated programming, data structures and algorithms, system architecture)
One dossier and two qualifying reports to document your interest in the study programme

Admission requirements:
RWTH Business School is looking for applicants who have a background in a technological area and at least a Bachelor of Engineering or Science degree in a STEM field (science, technology, engineering and mathematics).
Applicants need at least:
- 125 credit points in mathematics and/or natural sciences (e.g. physics, chemistry, computer science or similar)
- 25 credit points in the fields of higher mathematics or statistics, database and information systems, programming, algorithms and data structures, complexity theory, 
quantitative methods/operations research
Admission restrictions, see admission regulations

Area Of Study: Political Science | Philosophy | General Literary Studies | General Linguistic Science | Computational Linguistics | Data Science
Focus: Discourse analysis, Literary Studies, Linguistics, History, Computer Science, Political Science, Philosophy, Digital Humanities
Annotation: Part-time study: www.teilzeitstudium.tu-darmstadt.de.
Admission requirements:
- B.A. or J.B.A. Political science, sociology, history with a focus on modernity, digital philology at the University of Technology Darmstadt or a comparable degree course; if necessary, oral or written aptitude test; if necessary, admission is possible on a conditional basis of a maximum of 30 CP.
- Knowledge of English at level C1 CEFR. Proof is provided by school certificates or equivalents.

Bachelor's degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science or a related field with a minimum of three years of study and a minimum average score of 2.30. 

The Bachelor's program must cover the following contents as part of the study program:
(a) at least one module on Databases and
(b) at least 60 additional ECTS CPs in Computer Science events
or
(c) at least 40 further CP according to ECTS and 20 CP according to ECTS in Applied Statistics.
The CP or modules to be verified may not be internships or exercises.

Foreign students demonstrate sufficient knowledge of the German or English language at C1 level of the Common European Framework of Reference (e.g., DSH, TestDaf, TOEFL, IELTS, CAE).
The details of degree program equivalence and proof of language proficiency can be found in the examination regulations of the course, which can be accessed electronically from the main page of the degree course.

A professionally qualifying German degree or equivalent degree from a university abroad worth 180 credit points (CP) in Computer Science or another subject with study components in Mathematics modules worth at least 20 CP and Computer Science modules worth at least 10 CP. With regard to the Mathematics modules required under sentence 1, at least 5 CP must be demonstrated in the areas of Linear Algebra or Analysis and at least 5 CP in the areas of Probability Theory or Statistics. With regard to the Computer Science modules required under sentence 1, at least 5 CP must be demonstrated in the area of Algorithms and at least 5 CP in a module in which knowledge of a higher programming language, e.g. C/C++, Java or Python, has been acquired;
English language skills of level C1 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR)

University/Hochschule: University of Europe for Applied Sciences
Area Of Study: Systems Engineering | Applied Computer Science | Software Engineering
Annotation:
Duration of studies: 2, 3 or 4 semesters possible
Standard: 120 ECTS / fast track: 60 or 90 ECTS

Two central topics make up the Master’s degree in DevOps and Cloud Computing: DevOps – the integration of software development and IT operations - and cloud computing. It deals with the storage and management of data in a network. In this degree programme, students learn the necessary know-how for planning and controlling the DevOps culture in the increasingly digitised world of work. In this way, they not only relieve individual teams, but also ensure agile and effective work. And a better corporate culture.
